items.message: Monday evening's tide at 23:45 on 26/05/2025 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather, with strong South Westerly Force 6 winds and large waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.17 m. The total forecast tide is 6.06 metres Chart Datum (3.01 mAOD) at Littlehampton. For 2 hours either side of high tide, minimal flood impacts are expected. A small amount of water could find its way behind the beach and may pond on nearby land and fields, including at Climping Street Car Park and Mill Lane. Tuesday afternoon's tide at 12:00 27/05/2025 is forecast to be 17 cm lower (2.84 mAOD). Wednesday's early morning tide at 00:30 28/05/2025 is forecast to be 13 cm higher (3.14 mAOD) and accompanied by larger waves. Similar minor flood impacts might affect land and lanes at Climping beach early on Wednesday morning. We continue to monitor the forecast and routinely check the condition of the beach at Climping. Shingle can be thrown by waves. Access could be restricted during and after high tide. Take care if visiting Climping beach. We will update this message by 18:00 on 27/05/2025.

This Flood Alert has been issued due to the high tide forecast at Midnight on 27/05/2025. 
Flooding is possible at low lying lands and roads from 00:30 AM on 27/04/2025 at the following locations: 
Fiddlers Ferry, peaking around 00:45 AM
Eastford Road, peaking around 01:00 AM
Arpley Bridge, peaking around 01:15 AM
It is possible that river levels may affect Arpley Road under the railway bridge.    
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 27/05/2025, or as the situation changes.

Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible between 8:30 PM on 26/05/2025 and 12:30 AM on 27/05/2025. Property flooding is not expected.
Don't drive through floodwater or put yourself or others at risk.
After todayâ€™s high tide the risk of flooding from the period of spring tides will reduce as tide levels start falling.
This message will be updated by 9:00 AM on 27/05/2025, or as the situation changes.

Flooding is affecting low lying land, roads and gardens close to the River Mimram. The situation is now improving with reduced water levels in key hotspots.

We are monitoring the flooding affecting the Fulling Mill Lane, Singlers Marsh, and Codicote Road areas in Welwyn. 

Flooding to homes and businesses is unlikely at this time, but there may be a risk to very low-lying properties or those with basements. River levels in other areas remain below levels of concern. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. We are continuing to monitor the situation.

This message will be updated by 5pm, Wednesday 28th May 2025, or as the situation changes.
